info.title: Layblar Platform API
info.description:
# Introduction
This is the API Documentation for the Layblar-Platform.

tags.name: Authorization
tags.description: Authorizaton operations. Use these Endpoints to get a valid JWT for the Layblar Platform.

post.description: Creates a new user and assigns them to a new Household

get.description: Get a list of devices from the device library
Get a list of device categories from the device library
Get a Device category by a Id
Get a device by a Id
Get information about the given household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household for which the data should be fetched

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household for which the data should be fetched

200.description: List of all devices in the household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household from which the device should be removed

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household to which the device should be added

200.description: The household with the added device

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The id of the device that should be removed from the household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household from which the device should be removed

200.description: The household without the removed device

get.description: Get the code for joining the given household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household for which the join code should be fetched

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household that should be merged

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household that should be split

post.description: Register smart meter reader in given household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household to which the smart meter reader should be added

200.description: The household with the added smart meter reader

delete.description: Remove smart meter reader from given household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household from which the smart meter reader should be removed

200.description: The household without the removed smart meter reader

post.description: Adds new labeled data to the database
Sends a label event to match with smart meter data

get.summary: Returns a list of labeled data
get.description: Returns a list of labeled data for the specific household

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The householdId

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Optional projectId filter

put.description: Update the data of a labeled dataset

parameters.name: labeledDataId
parameters.description: The id of the labeled dataset to update

parameters.name: labeledDataId
parameters.description: The id of the labeled dataset to delete

get.description: Get the list of all available Metadata templates
List all Projects. The query parameter are not combinable! Only one is in effect!

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: Filter projects by householdId. List all projects where household is a participant

parameters.name: isJoinable
parameters.description: Lists only projects that are joinable for the caller. This only checks if the project is active and the household not already a participant

parameters.name: researcherId
parameters.description: Filter projects by researcherId. This can only be done by the Researcher role

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project to get

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project to update

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project to get data from

parameters.name: labeledDataId
parameters.description: When given returns only a single labeled data set for the project

get.summary: Get household metadata from a Project
get.description: Get household metadata from a Project

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The ID of the household

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

200.description: Household metadata for a project by id

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The ID of the household that wants to join the project

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project to join

get.description: Get a List of Smart-Meter data from the specified time frame

parameters.name: householdId
parameters.description: The id of the household for which the data should be fetched

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The begin of the time intervall for which the data should be fetched. Needs to be a Unix Timestamp as String

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Interval over which data should be aggregated (e.g 5 min, 1 hour, 1 day). Default are 5 seconds

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the time intervall for which the data should be fetched. Needs to be a Unix Timestamp as String

200.description: Smart-Meter data for the specified time period

deviceId.description: If not provided a new deviceId will be created

categories.description: At least one category must be provided

time.description: Time at which Smart-Meter data was recored

sensorId.description: Id of the Smart-Meter that recored the meassurement

1.7.0.description: This is the current positive active power in watts measured from Phase A.

1.8.0.description: This is the total positive active energy in watt-hours consumed or generated from Phase A.

2.7.0.description: This is the current negative active power in watts measured from Phase A. This could indicate generated energy.

2.8.0.description: This is the total negative active energy in watt-hours consumed or generated from Phase A.

3.8.0.description: This is the total positive reactive energy in var-hours consumed or generated from Phase A.

4.8.0.description: This is the total negative reactive energy in var-hours consumed or generated from Phase A

16.7.0.description: This is the difference between positive and negative active instantaneous power in watts from Phase A.

31.7.0.description: This is the current in amperes flowing in Phase L1.

32.7.0.description: This is the instantaneous voltage in volts in Phase L1.

51.7.0.description: This is the current in amperes flowing in Phase L2.

52.7.0.description: This is the instantaneous voltage in volts in Phase L2.

71.7.0.description: This is the current in amperes flowing in Phase L3.

72.7.0.description: This is the instantaneous voltage in volts in Phase L3.
